readability_reflection: The "+", my entire time learning code in the university i have never once used the "{}" to combine my strings together. Plus its a lot easier for most people since the sign "+" is so universal.
comprehension_debugging: concatenation helps me understand more when dealing with code debugs. Its easier to read and type up, also depending on how experience the person is, using {} inside of "" can be quite annoying.
preference_rationale: Concatenation, I just have more experience using it and it was taught in my classes.
learning_curve: It had a huge impact, working with strings for almost every assignment has helped me ease up the code examples.
suggestions_improvement: Concatenation seems easier to understand to most people because of the universal meaning of "+", however I don't mind my professors teaching us about the string interpolation, always good to learn the two.
